TopicTitle: [1.2] PlanetShine - v0.2.5.2 stable - v0.5 experimental [4 October 2016]

Articles.Content: Now my soon-to-be station using the Tantares pack looks GORGEOUS.
Hi could this be added to Kerbalstuff.com please, as alternative to curse

I got an idea today while landing on the Mun... Could you add the effect of your mod to the surfaces of non-atmosphereic bodies like the Mun or minmus?

What i mean is, Have the light travel like this...

Kerbol>Mun>Spacecraft So it would make the planet/moon glow with the reflected light from Kerbol? Of would this not be possible. So basically make light travel like it would in the kerbolverse

Incredible, beautiful, brilliant, should be stock, why didn't I know I couldn't live without it?

Thank you so very much for making this!

What exactly does the 'useVertex' config do? I'd assume it means vertex lighting, but what's the alternative if that's set to false?

What exactly does the 'useVertex' config do? I'd assume it means vertex lighting, but what's the alternative if that's set to false?

The alternative to vertex light is per-pixel light (See "Render Mode" in Unity Light documentation, look at "Important" and "Not Important" modes).

Vertex light is faster, and looks good enough for PlanetShine in my opinion.

Per-pixel light is supposed to better looking and more performance intensive, it allows shader effects such as reflections (on metallic surfaces for example) or bump mapping.

Instead of tweaking the config file by hand, you should use the in-game config menu, which has better explanations
